bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Memo from the Petitioner Attorneys
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: said George Hazzard has taken an appeal to the Supreme Court of Washington Territory.

Now if the above Court of on George Hazzard shall present his said appeal with effort, and with delay, shall pay with said James H. Price and atty. Aguirre all such costs and damages which shall lead Judges against the said George Hazzard in said appeal; and shall also safety and program the said Judgement so appealed from in can in shall be affirmed by the inform and: and shall also safety and any order a judgment which the Supreme Court may under order to be rendered by the said District Court: and shall also save the said James H. Price and M.G. Aguirre from the consequences aftating said appeal: and if the said George Hazzard shall detain himself of when said James H. Price and M.G. Aguirre or either of them when required advise by the said Supreme Court:and shall appear or before the said Supreme Court whenever when and whenever ordered by the Court copy the said Supreme Court, and shall abide by and perform any Judgement when or delay behind said by the Supreme Court in the then this obligation to be Wath and
